content: This place has changed a lot more than some of us realize. It used to be pretty freewheeling, and I would prefer that it go back to that, though not to an extreme. I have seen on multiple occasions where people use the mil.com version of PC (the so-called "questioning of service," which is always subjectively applied because it is undefined) to pretend offense just to get rid of an opposing viewpoint. It seems short-sighted to me, which is why I think people who use the yellow triangle are usually jerks. The only reason I've used it that I can remember is to point out someone that I think may be a previously suspended member under a new screename. That said, I've been suspended before (shocking, I know). To be honest, it's a good thing. I suspend myself from time to time, when I feel myself getting too wrapped up. Hell, I may be taking another voluntary vacation again pretty soon. The only reason I came back is because someone I respect a lot asked me to in an email. I had written the place off for good. Frankly, if you're not on warning or suspended around here a couple times, you're not trying hard enough.

content: DM Uhler was not banned from this site. If I recall, he closed his account to take his own vacation. This is probably a good thing to do anyway from time to time, so one doesn't get wrapped up in all the BS, and start taking things too seriously, which can result in poor judgement, thus resulting in unfounded attacks upon another poster. Dave has suspended his own account in the past, but always ended up coming back to this site. As a former moderator, I know for a fact that he has gone out of his way, to give advice to other posters and help keep them from getting in trouble on the boards, regardless of their political views. Dave, if you're reading this thread, come back when you're ready man! Some of us miss you! No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz

content: This place has changed a lot more than some of us realize. It used to be pretty freewheeling, and I would prefer that it go back to that, though not to an extreme. I have seen on multiple occasions where people use the mil.com version of PC (the so-called "questioning of service," which is always subjectively applied because it is undefined) to pretend offense just to get rid of an opposing viewpoint. It seems short-sighted to me, which is why I think people who use the yellow triangle are usually jerks. The only reason I've used it that I can remember is to point out someone that I think may be a previously suspended member under a new screename. That said, I've been suspended before (shocking, I know). To be honest, it's a good thing. I suspend myself from time to time, when I feel myself getting too wrapped up. Hell, I may be taking another voluntary vacation again pretty soon. The only reason I came back is because someone I respect a lot asked me to in an email. I had written the place off for good. Frankly, if you're not on warning or suspended around here a couple times, you're not trying hard enough.

content: DM Uhler was not banned from this site. If I recall, he closed his account to take his own vacation. This is probably a good thing to do anyway from time to time, so one doesn't get wrapped up in all the BS, and start taking things too seriously, which can result in poor judgement, thus resulting in unfounded attacks upon another poster. Dave has suspended his own account in the past, but always ended up coming back to this site. As a former moderator, I know for a fact that he has gone out of his way, to give advice to other posters and help keep them from getting in trouble on the boards, regardless of their political views. Dave, if you're reading this thread, come back when you're ready man! Some of us miss you! No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz

content: DM Uhler was not banned from this site. If I recall, he closed his account to take his own vacation. This is probably a good thing to do anyway from time to time, so one doesn't get wrapped up in all the BS, and start taking things too seriously, which can result in poor judgement, thus resulting in unfounded attacks upon another poster. Dave has suspended his own account in the past, but always ended up coming back to this site. As a former moderator, I know for a fact that he has gone out of his way, to give advice to other posters and help keep them from getting in trouble on the boards, regardless of their political views. Dave, if you're reading this thread, come back when you're ready man! Some of us miss you! No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz

content: This place has changed a lot more than some of us realize. It used to be pretty freewheeling, and I would prefer that it go back to that, though not to an extreme. I have seen on multiple occasions where people use the mil.com version of PC (the so-called "questioning of service," which is always subjectively applied because it is undefined) to pretend offense just to get rid of an opposing viewpoint. It seems short-sighted to me, which is why I think people who use the yellow triangle are usually jerks. The only reason I've used it that I can remember is to point out someone that I think may be a previously suspended member under a new screename. That said, I've been suspended before (shocking, I know). To be honest, it's a good thing. I suspend myself from time to time, when I feel myself getting too wrapped up. Hell, I may be taking another voluntary vacation again pretty soon. The only reason I came back is because someone I respect a lot asked me to in an email. I had written the place off for good. Frankly, if you're not on warning or suspended around here a couple times, you're not trying hard enough.

content: DM Uhler was not banned from this site. If I recall, he closed his account to take his own vacation. This is probably a good thing to do anyway from time to time, so one doesn't get wrapped up in all the BS, and start taking things too seriously, which can result in poor judgement, thus resulting in unfounded attacks upon another poster. Dave has suspended his own account in the past, but always ended up coming back to this site. As a former moderator, I know for a fact that he has gone out of his way, to give advice to other posters and help keep them from getting in trouble on the boards, regardless of their political views. Dave, if you're reading this thread, come back when you're ready man! Some of us miss you! No one starts a war--or rather, no one in his senses ought to do so--without first being clear in his mind what he intends to achieve by that war and how he intends to conduct it. Carl von Clausewitz
